item.title: Auto close quotes for markdown in VsCode
item.description: Sometimes I want to auto-close double quotes and ` in markdown mode. In settings we have such settings but they are not working in plain text files like makrdown. Find “language-configuration.json” under markdown-basic folder. My path: C:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\markdown-basics\language-configuration.json Add what you want auto close and save it. "autoClosingPairs": [ { "open": "{", "close": "}" }, { "open": "`", "close": "`" }, { "open": "\"", "close": "\"" }, { "open": "[", "close": "]" }, { "open": "(", "close": ")" }, { "open": "<", "close": ">", "notIn": [ "string" ] } ], BTW use Ctrl+M Ctrl+C you could generate a code block in markdown.

item.title: Using latex with VsCode
item.description: Refer On windows: Install texLive. Add the path to environment variable. Install “Latex workship” on vscode. Open your tex file, View Latex PDF File, you are ready to go. On manjaro: sudo pacman -S textlive-most
